channel.title: Models :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Database Models Now that we have our database table structure and sample data set up, we can finally configure sequelize to query our database by defining a model representing that data. At its core, a model is simply an abstraction that represents the structure of the data in a table of our database. We can equate this to a class in object-oriented programming - each row or record in our database can be thought of as an instance of our model class. You can learn more about models in the Sequelize Documentation
